question: I have mountains without land, seas without water, and roads without cars. What am I?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
I’m tall when I’m young and short when I’m old. What am I?
What goes up but never comes down?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has many keys but can’t open a single lock?
The more there is, the less you see. What is it?
What has hands but can’t clap?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk, or leaves. What am I?
What has a neck but no head?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for long. What am I?
What runs around a backyard but never moves?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
What has one eye but can’t see?
What belongs to you but other people use it more than you do?
If you drop me I’m sure to crack, but give me a smile and I’ll always smile back. What am I?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. Who am I?
What gets bigger the more you take away?
I’m full of holes but I still hold water. What am I?
What has a thumb and four fingers but isn’t alive?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
What word is spelled incorrectly in every dictionary?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
Where does today come before yesterday?
What invention lets you look right through a wall?
I go all around the world but always stay in one spot. What am I?
What has a bed but never sleeps and a mouth but never eats?
What has lots of eyes but can’t see?
What has ears but cannot hear?
What kind of coat is best put on wet?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What has four wheels and flies?
What comes down but never goes up?
What can you hold in your right hand but not in your left?
What has a ring but no finger?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
What can you keep after giving to someone?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
What has many teeth but can’t bite?
What goes through cities and fields but never moves?
What has legs but doesn’t walk?
What comes with a bed but never sleeps and runs but never walks?
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
What can you hear but not touch or see, and even though you control it, it always controls you?
